column3: utACK 12e881b.\n\nBTW, should be `if (psomething)` or `if (psomething != nullptr)`, etc?
> Can you please handle these: <*.mm>\n\nAre you sure that's safe? Isn't that some C++ mongrel? Does "Objective C++" have the same rules as C++11 in this regard?
See e.g. Apple's sample programs (https://developer.apple.com/library/content/samplecode/GL3_Text/Listings/Sources_Toolkits_OpenGL_Shaders_GLUProgram_mm.html). It should be safe.

>  It should be safe.

OK. Just wanted to bring it up.

Seems to need rebase now.
